alert.note: Alert for White River (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 11 at 1:22PM MDT until June 13 at 11:00PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 11 PM MDT MONDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND DRY FUELS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 202... The National Weather Service in Grand Junction has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds, low relative humidity and dry fuels, which is in effect from 11 AM to 11 PM MDT Monday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...In Colorado, Fire Weather Zone 202 White River Forecast Area. * WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts 40 to 50 mph. Cold frontal passage late Monday will turn winds to the Northwest. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Conditions could be favorable for easy ignition and rapid spread of fires due to low relative humidity and strong gusty winds.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
